meanings.definition: To bring together into a collective whole.
meanings.sent1: The community is collectivizing their efforts to clean up the park.
meanings.sent2: The farmers are collectivizing their resources to purchase new equipment.
meanings.sent3: The ants are collectivizing their food storage for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The students are collectivizing their knowledge to solve the math problem together.
meanings.sent5: The team is collectivizing their skills to win the championship.

meanings.sent1: The workers are collectivizing their demands for better working conditions.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers are collectivizing their efforts to help the homeless.
meanings.sent3: The bees are collectivizing their efforts to build a new hive.
meanings.sent4: The musicians are collectivizing their talents to create a beautiful symphony.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors are collectivizing their resources to throw a block party.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a collective or group.
meanings.sent1: The collectivizing of the students into study groups improved their grades.
meanings.sent2: The collectivizing of the community led to a stronger sense of unity.
meanings.sent3: The collectivizing of the animals in the zoo made for an interesting exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The collectivizing of the employees into teams increased productivity.
meanings.sent5: The collectivizing of the audience into a choir created a harmonious sound.
